Friday, June 8, 2007























Liver cancer patients get hope from kidney cancer drug
For the first time, doctors say they have found a pill that improves survival for people with liver cancer, a notoriously hard to treat disease diagnosed in more than half a million people globally each year.
FULL STORY




















Study: Omega-3 fatty acids reduce blood pressure
A diet with liberal servings of fish, nuts and seeds rich in nutrients called omega-3 fatty acids can help lower a person's blood pressure, according to a study released Monday.
FULL STORY






Study: Doctors biased in prostate cancer treatment
The type of prostate cancer treatment a man gets has a lot to do with the kind of specialist he sees first, a new study says, backing up what many have long suspected.
FULL STORY






Scientists: Key advance in stem cell research
Three teams of scientists say they have produced the equivalent of embryonic stem cells, at least in mice, without taking the controversial step of destroying embryos.
FULL STORY






CDC: 2006 West Nile virus deaths highest since '03
Deaths from the mosquito-borne West Nile virus increased last year to their highest level since 2003, a report from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says.
FULL STORY
